critical_issues: Minor calibration/wording risk: Some mechanistic claims are labeled "strong" without explicitly scoping them to the preclinical (mouse) setting (for example, IFNAR1 necessity). The underlying evidence is preclinical in the report (L39), so downstream users should avoid interpreting this as proven in humans.

Minor phrasing imprecision in the public summary: "vaccinated patients showed a lower survival p-value" is an awkward construction. The report states a survival comparison p-value of 0.01 with improved survival association in the vaccinated subgroup (L30), not a separate p-value per group.
value.summary: Across the four JSON outputs, the extracted study design, cohorts, quantitative values, controls, mechanistic chain, and caveats align with the report and use valid line references (L14–L16, L19–L23, L28–L33, L36–L40, L48–L56). No new quantitative claims were introduced beyond those in the report. The outputs include the key limitations of the retrospective human analysis (L49–L53) and appropriately treat the human finding as associative/observational. Overall, the JSON is coherent and suitable/
